content: spendigo 2025 © sandra levey 2025 this is my second *spendigo-named beanie but this time i have opted for a slightly heavier weight yarn this is a snug fitting beanie please see notes regarding any alteration to size or yarn weight that you wish to make as i m hoping this single pattern can be used across various yarn weights for multiple projects *the nickname used by shoppers at the australian sheep and wool show **photo shown has chart worked from round six see page three for close up of brim and chart worked from round one size 56cm 22 head see notes below re other sizes yarn colour 1 debbie bliss cashmerino aran - sample used colour 300502 - 1 ball colour 2 debbie bliss cashmerino aran - sample used colour 300041 - 1 ball despite being classed as aran weight i feel that this yarn is similar to worsted gauge 21 sts and 24 row to 10cm needles 4 0mm and 4 5mm circular needles in 40cm 4 5mm dpn s for working crown notions one stitch marker measuring tape tapestry needle for weaving in ends skills required knit in the round knit through back loop ssk decreases k2tog decreases 2 colour stranded knitting abbreviations k - knit p - purl sts - stitches repeat - repeat rem - remaining dpn s - double pointed needles ssk - slip slip knit left leaning decrease tbl - through back loop twisted stitch k2tog - knit two stitches together right leaning decrease 1 spendigo 2025 ©sandra levey - released 7 june 2025 notes you may wish to try this pattern in different yarn weights with little or no changes required other than needle size the charted body requires multiples of 10 sts so any alterations you plan make it necessary for you to increase stitches on the first round of the body don t like twisted rib just work a plain k1p1 instead want a turned over brim sure just add sufficient length ensuring you have additional yarn the main body is too tall subtract a few rounds at the beginning of the chart next time not slouchy enough add a few rounds at the beginning either with c1 or c2 or simply a stripe of each alternately before commencing the chart big hair increase by 10 stitches during round one of the chart work three colours brim as one chart as two others great for team colours remember that any increases you make will affect the height at the crown requiring you to decide when to finish with a number other than 10 stitches please ensure you catch long floats in your preferred method and always ensure you have additional yarn for any increases you make pattern using c1 and the 4 0mm needle cast on 100 sts join in the round ensuring stitches are not twisted place a stitch marker work a k1tbl p1 ribbing until work measures 4cm using the 4 5mm needle commence working from the
